Table of Contents

Class TcpIpcProvider

Namespace
osu.Framework.Platform
Assembly
osu.Framework.dll

An inter-process communication provider that runs over a specified TCP port, binding to the loopback address. This single class handles both binding as a server, or messaging another bound instance that is acting as a server.

public class TcpIpcProvider : IDisposable

Constructors

TcpIpcProvider(int)

Create a new provider.

public TcpIpcProvider(int port)

Parameters

port int

The port to operate on.

Methods

Bind()

Attempt to bind to the TCP port as a server, and start listening for incoming connections if successful.

public bool Bind()

Returns

bool

Whether the bind was successful. If false, another instance is likely already running (and can be messaged using SendMessageAsync(IpcMessage) or SendMessageWithResponseAsync(IpcMessage)).

Dispose()

Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

public void Dispose()

SendMessageAsync(IpcMessage)

Send a message to the IPC server.

public Task SendMessageAsync(IpcMessage message)

Parameters

message IpcMessage

The message to send.

Returns

Task

SendMessageWithResponseAsync(IpcMessage)

Send a message to the IPC server.

public Task<IpcMessage?> SendMessageWithResponseAsync(IpcMessage message)

Parameters

message IpcMessage

The message to send.

Returns

Task<IpcMessage>

The response from the server.

Events

MessageReceived

Invoked when a message is received when running as a server. Returns either a response in the form of an IpcMessage, or null for no response.

public event Func<IpcMessage, IpcMessage?>? MessageReceived

Event Type

Func<IpcMessage, IpcMessage>
